meanings.definition: A hormone secreted by the adrenal glands in response to stress or excitement.
meanings.sent1: When I saw the dog chasing me, my adrenaline kicked in, and I ran faster.
meanings.sent2: Athletes often feel a rush of adrenaline before a big game.
meanings.sent3: The adrenaline in my body made me jump at the sound of a door slamming.
meanings.sent4: Her adrenaline was like a powerful engine propelling her forward in the race.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster ride was so thrilling that it felt like pure adrenaline pumping through my veins.

meanings.definition: A synthetic form of the hormone adrenaline used as a medication to treat severe allergic reactions.
meanings.sent1: The doctor administered adrenaline to the patient to counteract the allergic reaction quickly.
meanings.sent2: In emergencies, medical professionals rely on adrenaline to save lives.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power was like having an unlimited supply of adrenaline shots.
meanings.sent4: The adrenaline injection worked like magic, bringing the patient back from the brink.
meanings.sent5: The adrenaline shot was the hero of the day, swiftly reversing the allergic symptoms.
